page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The block consists mainly of gently undulating arable farmland and includes the parishes of Beetley (not Old Beetley), Gressenhall and Hoe. Residential development is largely confined to the built up areas of New Beetley and Gressenhall.The children within the block attend St Mary's County Primary School. Most of the farmland is devoted to cereal crops, but there is a large fruit farm at Gorgate Hall. The Norfolk Rural Life Museum is situated at Beech House, Gressenhall. It shares the building with the Norfolk Archeological Unit. A tributary of the River Wensum runs to the south of Beetley and Gressenhall. There is a small deciduous wood to the North of St Mary's School.
